Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Patrick Murphy "never worked as a CPA" and was "never a small business owner" when in fact he did work as a CPA for a period of time and had an economic interest in a small business.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it fails to provide evidence or specific examples to back up the assertion that Patrick Murphy never worked as a CPA or small business owner.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by suggesting that holding a lesser title before becoming a CPA and working as a CPA for less than a year disqualifies Murphy from being considered a CPA or small business owner.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that Murphy did work as a CPA, but in a different state while holding a Colorado CPA license, which may have led to confusion or misunderstanding.
